repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Second Public Enterprise Reform
            Adjustment Loan Project (Peral II)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Public Enterprise
            Reform Adjustment Loan Project (PERAL II) for Argentina were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project
            sustainability was likely, Bank performance was highly
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: Argentina is the only country
            in the hemisphere, and among only a handful of countries in
            the world, which has undertaken a major reform covering its
            defense complex. As a result of its uniqueness, the strong
            vested role of the Argentine military, and the Bank's
            limited historic involvement in the defense sector, the
            PERAL II program was innovative and creative. A key
            requirement of the privatization process for oligopolistic
            industry is the enforcement of laws that effectively promote
            competition and protect consumer rights. Although these laws
            existed, there institutional and enforcement capability was
            minimal. With this inadequate framework, it was almost
            impossible to intervene solely through bidding documents.
            Therefore, there was further concentration in asset
            ownership, especially in the steel and petrochemical
            sectors. The lesson is that statements of competitive
            principles in sales memoranda may not be appropriate in
            enforcing ant monopolistic behavior during the privatization
            process. Therefore, strong laws and institutions need to be
            well in place. Managing cross-ministerial relationships and
            multiple objectives is complex under a single loan. This
            loan's principal objective was to privatize Public
            Enterprises (PEs) under the Ministry of Defense. However,
            since a large number of PEs were in the tradable sector,
            there was a need to modify the prevailing laws for
            competition policy and costumiers protection, which was the
            primary responsibility of the Ministry of Economy.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Second Public Enterprise Reform
            Adjustment Loan (PERAL II) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Public Enterprise Reform
            Adjustment Loan Project (Peral II), which is an integral
            part of the Bank's support for the Argentine
            Government's adjustment program will assist in:  (a)
            privatizing / restructuring of public enterprises in the
            Ministry of Defense; (b) reducing public finance deficits;
            and (c) improving the environment for competitive private
            sector activity and investment.
